revised_title: Human Adaptability in a Tropical Ecosystem: Respiratory Responses to Carbon Dioxide in New Guinea Communities
tldr: This study investigates the anthropometric and other factors affecting respiratory responses to carbon dioxide in two New Guinea communities. The results highlight the importance of vital capacity and tolerance to carbon dioxide loads, showing differences between men and women. The research emphasizes the adaptability of humans in a tropical ecosystem.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Human Biology
